addressleaf.section: To the right honorable my very singular good Lord the L. Burghley Lord highe Treasurer of England.

2 N
o
1592.
M
r
Bodeleie to my L. from the Haghe./

page.lettertext:
fol.323r
May it please yo
r
good L. being charged againe
by my
LL. of
e Councel
, to send away
e troupe
of
S
r
Nicholas Parker
, I have sent heereinclosed mine
answear unto them: w
ch
yo
r
L. will vouchesafe
to accompany w
t
suche mater, as I have formerly
signified, and to certifie my care, to accomplishe
w
at
soever is required at my handes. Sins I writte
my last unto yo
r
L.
e 25 of Oc
t
S
r
Thomas Shirleis
Deputie hath sent me worde,
at
e shippers of
Zeland
doe flatly refuse to be hired for
Jerdsey:
for w
ch
he
should be forced to repaire into
England,
for some
further direction. By whome I humbly beseeche
yo
w
,
at I may by letters be advertised, w
at
orders
are sette downe. I shall be able thereby both to no-
tifie
e same, when I deale w
t
e
states,
w
ch
I could
not doe hitherto (for
at my instructions are onely
for
Caen
) and likewise to S
r
Nicholas Parker, and
give him for many thinges a sounder addresse. For
otherwise as nowe, I am nether informed in time
convenient of suche alterations, nor in particular
maner, and by privat letters onely, w
t
out warrant
sufficient to proceede upon it. The
Councel of estate
hath made a newe proposition to
the General states, to
e self same effect as they did
e last yere: for
e raising of an extraordinarie
contribution of ninetie thousand poundes sterlinge:
to be imploied
e next sommer in
e service of the
contrey. For this they promise to levie, above their
present numbers, three thousand footmen, and three
or fower hundred horse. Among other their induce-
ments, to winne
e people to their purpose, they
fol.323v
alleage
e w
t
drawing of these troupes of her
Ma
tie
.
The proposition is made to
e assemblie
at is heere,
but is by them to be presented to every several Pro-
vince. But by common conjecture they will not
have resolved these two or three monethes.
And
thus I take my humble leave. From
e Hage
N
o
2 1592.
Yo
r
L. most humbly bounden Tho. Bodley
